items.title: eClerx Services rallies 4% after Q3 profit surge; bonus issue nod
items.description: eClerx shares surged following a robust quarterly performance. The company's board approved a 1:1 bonus share issue. Net profit rose 40% year-on-year to Rs 192 crore for the December quarter. Revenue from operations also saw a significant increase. The bonus shares will be issued from retained earnings. The company expects to credit bonus shares by March 2026.

items.title: Hindustan Copper shares soar to record high, surge 40% in 4 days. What's behind the rally?
items.description: Hindustan Copper shares surged 40% in four sessions to a 52-week high as record global copper prices and the company’s emergence as the preferred bidder for a new mining block in Madhya Pradesh fueled a fresh wave of buying in the state-owned miner.

items.title: Smallcap bloodbath: 10 stocks tumble up to 40% in first month of 2026. Do you own any?
items.description: The pain in India’s smallcap space is no longer limited to a handful of overheated names. Just weeks into 2026, more than 600 smallcap stocks have already slipped into double-digit negative territory. What makes this phase particularly unsettling is that it has not been sudden. The correction has been building for nearly a year. After a powerful run fuelled by abundant liquidity, aggressive retail participation and optimism around India’s long-term growth story, the market began to fracture in 2024. Here are 10 stocks that have borne the brunt of this downturn in 2026.

items.title: Hindustan Zinc OFS opens: How can retail investors participate?
items.description: Hindustan Zinc’s Offer For Sale (OFS) opens for retail investors on Thursday, January 29, after strong demand from non-retail participants. Vedanta, the promoter, aims to raise up to Rs 4,500 crore through the sale of 0.79% of the company’s equity, with a green shoe option of 0.59% additional stake if demand remains robust. The indicative price is Rs 691.15.

items.title: GRSE shares soar 5%, up 18% in two sessions. What’s triggering the surge?
items.description: GRSE shares rallied sharply after the defence shipbuilder posted strong year-on-year growth in profit and revenue for the December 2025 quarter. Higher operational scale, steady margins and a second interim dividend announcement boosted investor sentiment.

items.title: Silver up 50% this month. Is it now time for gold to outpace its poor cousin?
items.description: Silver has surged nearly 50% this month, dramatically outshining gold. Investors are now questioning if gold will catch up. Both metals have seen significant gains, driven by geopolitical uncertainty and expectations of interest rate cuts. Experts suggest gold offers stability, while silver's sharp rise comes with higher volatility.

items.title: Sensex sinks over 600 pts, Nifty below 25,200 as Union Budget focus takes hold
items.description: Indian stock markets opened lower today. The Sensex and Nifty saw a slight dip. Investors are now focusing on the upcoming federal budget. This comes after a recent rally driven by trade agreement optimism. Market participants are shifting their attention to domestic policy announcements expected this weekend.

items.title: Buy, Sell or Hold? Goldman Sachs reiterates Buy on L&T; Morgan Stanley stays Overweight on TVS Motor
items.description: Brokerages are positive on L&T, TVS Motor, and Maruti Suzuki. L&T shows strong order inflows and profitability. TVS Motor benefits from margin expansion and industry tailwinds. Maruti Suzuki expects new products and export growth to boost earnings. These companies are poised for growth driven by various factors.

items.title: FIIs dump 2 stocks for every one bought, smallcaps worst hit. What it means for investors
items.description: Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) significantly reduced their holdings in Indian equities during the December quarter, selling nearly two stocks for every one purchased, with smallcaps bearing the brunt. This exodus, driven by high valuations and modest earnings growth, saw FIIs divest from 814 stocks while acquiring only 478 across various market segments.

items.title: Maruti Suzuki shares decline over 3% after Q3 results; Should buy, sell or hold?
items.description: Maruti Suzuki's shares fell after reporting a modest 4% profit rise in Q3 FY26, missing street expectations. Despite strong revenue growth driven by domestic demand, margins were hit by lower export realisations and one-time costs. The company achieved record domestic and total sales, with the small car segment showing a strong recovery.

items.title: L&T shares rise 4% as order inflows hit record high in Q3; what's next
items.description: Larsen & Toubro shares climbed 4% to Rs 3,935 on Thursday. The company reported a 4.3% drop in net profit for the December quarter. This was due to a one-time provision for employee benefits. Excluding this, profit grew 31%. Revenue increased 10% year-on-year. Order inflows reached an all-time high of Rs 1.36 lakh crore.

items.title: TVS Motor Company shares in focus after Q3. Should you buy, sell or hold?
items.description: TVS Motor Company reported a robust 49% year-on-year jump in consolidated net profit to Rs 841 crore for the December quarter, driven by record sales and revenue. The two-wheeler major's overall sales grew 27% YoY to 15.44 lakh units, with strong performance across motorcycles, scooters, and international markets.

items.title: Cochin Shipyard among 8 Nifty200 stocks showing bullish RSI upswing
items.description: On January 28, eight stocks from the Nifty200 universe that gained over 5% were highlighted in the RSI Trending Up scan, based on data from StockEdge.com. It is an uptrend signal if the RSI value has crossed above 50 from below. "RSI trending up" means that the Relative Strength Index (RSI) values are increasing, suggesting strengthening momentum in the price of the stock. This can indicate potential upward movement and may be used by traders to identify buying opportunities.

items.title: KRM Ayurveda shares list at 28% premium over IPO price on NSE SME platform
items.description: KRM Ayurveda debuted on Dalal Street with a strong 27.5% listing premium, opening at Rs 172.1 against its IPO price of Rs 135. The Rs 77 crore issue saw overwhelming demand, subscribed over 74 times across investor categories. This robust response signals investor confidence in the Ayurvedic healthcare provider's expansion plans.

items.title: Positive Breakout: These 12 stocks cross above their 200 DMAs
items.description: As of January 28, 2026, 22 stocks in the Nifty 500 segment closed above their 200-day moving average (DMA). Of these, we have highlighted the top 12 that posted gains of more than 3%, based on StockEdge’s technical scan data. The 200-day daily moving average (DMA) is used as a key indicator by traders for determining the overall trend in a particular stock. As long as the stock is priced above the 200-day SMA on the daily time frame, it is generally considered to be an overall uptrend. Take a look:

items.title: GIFT Nifty down 65 points; here's the trading setup for today's session
items.description: Indian stock markets closed higher on Wednesday. Positive global sentiment and optimism surrounding the India-EU Free Trade Agreement fueled the gains. Analysts anticipate this upward trend to continue. Upcoming budget expectations and ongoing Q3 earnings season are also contributing factors. Global markets showed mixed movements. Foreign investors were net buyers.

items.title: If wealth creation is the goal, how does the Indian Budget balance market-friendly policies with revenue pressures?
items.description: Investors are looking for a Budget that encourages growth without weakening fiscal stability. A focus on productive capex, selective incentives and realistic revenue planning usually enhances confidence. The interplay between market-friendly policy choices and fiscal pressures will shape the overall response.

items.title: MCX shares soar nearly 20% in 3 sessions! What’s behind the sharp surge?
items.description: Multi Commodity Exchange of India shares surged on Thursday. The company reported a significant 151% year-on-year jump in net profit for the quarter ended December 31, 2026. This bullishness was further fueled by rising gold and silver prices. Higher trading volumes directly boosted MCX revenues and operational performance. The exchange also saw substantial growth in trading activity across segments.

items.title: Bharat Electronics shares slip 3% as Nomura retains ‘Neutral’ rating, citing rich valuations
items.description: The company’s order backlog stood at Rs 730.2 billion as of December 2025, up 3% year-on-year. The company said that this implies an order inflow of Rs 56.8 billion during 3QFY26, which was broadly in line with estimates.

items.title: Rs 3 lakh crore wiped out! Sensex slumps over 600 points, Nifty below 25,200. What spooked the market today?
items.description: Indian equities experienced a sharp decline on Thursday, erasing recent gains as caution set in ahead of the Union Budget. Investors locked in profits and pivoted from global trade optimism to domestic policy risks, leading to a broad-based selloff. Market strategists suggest the recent rally was tactical, with foreign institutional investors maintaining a 'sell India' strategy.

items.title: Capex vs refinancing: What Budget 2026 must do to revive private investment
items.description: The Union Budget FY27 pivots to a debt-anchoring framework, aiming for fiscal consolidation amidst slowing domestic consumption.  With fading tax buoyancy, the government will increasingly rely on non-tax revenues and expenditure compression.  Capex is normalizing, with a shift towards off-budget spending and state-led initiatives.

items.title: Explained: Why Hindustan Zinc shares are down 2% despite silver prices soaring to Rs 4 lakh
items.description: Hindustan Zinc shares have fallen about 2% over the last two sessions despite silver prices hitting a record Rs 4 lakh, reflecting a disconnect between the commodity rally and the stock. The decline is not due to fundamentals but is driven by short-term supply pressure from promoter Vedanta’s ongoing OFS, which has added fresh shares to the market through a base sale and a greenshoe option.
